javax.time.jdk8

Class DefaultInterfaceEra<C extends Chrono<C>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.time.jdk8.DefaultInterfaceDateTimeAccessor
      • javax.time.jdk8.DefaultInterfaceEra<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - the chronology of this era
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DateTime.WithAdjuster, DateTimeAccessor, Era<C>

    public abstract class DefaultInterfaceEra<C extends Chrono<C>>
extends DefaultInterfaceDateTimeAccessor
implements Era<C>
    A temporary class providing implementations that will become default interface methods once integrated into JDK 8.

    • Method Detail

      • date

        public ChronoLocalDate<C> date(int year,
                      int month,
                      int day)
        Description copied from interface: Era
        Obtains a date in this era given the year-of-era, month, and day.

        This era is combined with the given date fields to form a date. The year specified must be the year-of-era. Methods to create a date from the proleptic-year are on Chrono. This always uses the standard form of the chronology.

        Specified by:
        date in interface Era<C extends Chrono<C>>
        Parameters:
        year - the calendar system year-of-era
        month - the calendar system month-of-year
        day - the calendar system day-of-month
        Returns:
        a local date based on this era and the specified year-of-era, month and day

        Description copied from interface: Era
        Obtains a date in this era given year-of-era and day-of-year fields.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        dayOfYear - the calendar system day-of-year
        Returns:

      • isSupported

        public boolean isSupported(DateTimeField field)
        Description copied from interface: DateTimeAccessor
        Checks if the specified date-time field is supported.

        This checks if the date-time can be queried for the specified field. If false, then calling the range and get methods will throw an exception.

        Implementation notes

        Implementations must check and handle any fields defined in ChronoField before delegating on to the doRange method on the specified field.
        Specified by:
        isSupported in interface DateTimeAccessor
        Parameters:
        field - the field to check, null returns false
        Returns:
        true if this date-time can be queried for the field, false if not

      • get

        public int get(DateTimeField field)
        Description copied from interface: DateTimeAccessor
        Gets the value of the specified date-time field as an int.

        This queries the date-time for the value for the specified field. The returned value will always be within the valid range of values for the field. If the date-time cannot return the value, because the field is unsupported or for some other reason, an exception will be thrown.

        Implementation notes

        Implementations must check and handle any fields defined in ChronoField before delegating on to the doGet method on the specified field.
        Specified by:
        get in interface DateTimeAccessor
        Overrides:
        get in class DefaultInterfaceDateTimeAccessor
        Parameters:
        field - the field to get, not null
        Returns:
        the value for the field

      • getLong

        public long getLong(DateTimeField field)
        Description copied from interface: DateTimeAccessor
        Gets the value of the specified date-time field as a Long.

        This queries the date-time for the value for the specified field. The returned value may be outside the valid range of values for the field. If the date-time cannot return the value, because the field is unsupported or for some other reason, an exception will be thrown.

        Implementation notes

        Implementations must check and handle any fields defined in ChronoField before delegating on to the doGet method on the specified field.
        Specified by:
        getLong in interface DateTimeAccessor
        Parameters:
        field - the field to get, not null
        Returns:
        the value for the field

      • doWithAdjustment

        public DateTime doWithAdjustment(DateTime dateTime)
        Description copied from interface: DateTime.WithAdjuster
        Implementation of the strategy to make an adjustment to the specified date-time object.

        This method is not intended to be called by application code directly. Instead, the DateTime.with(WithAdjuster) method should be used: 

           dateTime = dateTime.with(adjuster);

        Implementation notes

        The implementation takes the input object and adjusts it according to an algorithm. For example, it could be used to adjust a date to "next Wednesday".

        Implementations must use the methods on DateTime to make the adjustment. The returned object must have the same observable type as this object. The input object will be mutated if it is mutable, or a new object returned if immutable.

        This interface can be used by calendar systems other than ISO. Implementations may choose to document compatibility with other calendar systems, or validate for it by querying the chronology from the input object.

        Specified by:
        doWithAdjustment in interface DateTime.WithAdjuster
        Parameters:
        dateTime - the date-time object to adjust, not null
        Returns:
        an object of the same type with the adjustment made, not null

      • query

        public <R> R query(DateTimeAccessor.Query<R> query)
        Description copied from interface: DateTimeAccessor
        Queries this date-time.

        This queries this date-time using the specified query strategy object. The Query interface has three special predefined constants - Query.ZONE_ID, Query.CHRONO and Query.TIME_PRECISION. Other queries may be defined by applications.

        Implementation notes

        Queries are used for two purposes - general application specific logic, and providing a way to query those parts of a DateTimeAccessor that cannot be returned as a long using a field.

        In use, there is no difference between the two purposes. However, there is a difference in implementation. It is the responsibility of implementations of this method to return a value for the three special constants if applicable. Future JDKs are permitted to add further special constants.

        The standard implementation of this method will be similar to the following: 

           public <R> R query(Query<R> type) {
     // only include an if statement if the implementation can return it
     if (query == Query.ZONE_ID)  return // the ZoneId
     if (query == Query.CHRONO)  return // the Chrono
     if (query == Query.PRECISION)  return // the precision
     // call default method
     return super.query(query);
   }
        If the implementation class has no zone, chronology or precision, then the class can rely totally on the default implementation.
        Specified by:
        query in interface DateTimeAccessor
        Overrides:
        query in class DefaultInterfaceDateTimeAccessor
        Type Parameters:
        R - the type of the result
        Parameters:
        query - the query to invoke, not null
        Returns:
        the query result, null may be returned (defined by the query)

      • getText

        public String getText(TextStyle style,
             Locale locale)
        Description copied from interface: Era
        Gets the textual representation of this era.

        This returns the textual name used to identify the era. The parameters control the length of the returned text and the locale.

        If no textual mapping is found then the numeric value is returned.

        Specified by:
        getText in interface Era<C extends Chrono<C>>
        Parameters:
        style - the length of the text required, not null
        locale - the locale to use, not null
        Returns:
        the text value of the era, not null
